ContentInfo.ContentComment: Default Exception Assistant Content for Visual Studio 8.0.

Tip.Description: Check the InnerException property for more information.
Make sure there is a startup form.
Check to ensure TextFieldType and Delimiter are defined correctly.
Use the "new" keyword to create an object instance.
Check to determine if the object is null before calling the method.
Make sure the arguments to this method have valid values.
If you are working with a collection, make sure the index is less than the size of the collection.
When using the overloaded two-argument FindString or FindExactString methods with a ComboBox or ListBox, check the startIndex parameter.
Make sure the object type is convertible to the array type.
Make sure the file image is a valid managed assembly.
Make sure you have supplied a correct file path for the assembly.
Make sure you are not trying to unload an application domain that is the default domain, has a running thread, or is already unloaded.
Make sure the value of the denominator is not zero before performing a division operation.
Make sure the WaitHandle objects passed to WaitAll or WaitAny method are unique.
If the access level of a field in a class library has changed, recompile any assemblies that reference that library.
Make sure your method arguments are in the right format.
When converting a string to DateTime, parse the string to take the date before putting each variable into the DateTime object.
Make sure that the maximum index on a list is less than the list size.
Make sure the index is not a negative number.
Make sure data column names are correct.
When casting from a number, the value must be a number less than infinity.
Make sure the source type is convertible to the destination type.
If you are using the Graphics object after the GetHdc method, call the ReleaseHdc method.
Turn off the Console Window.
Turn off the Console Window.
How to make cross-thread calls to Windows Forms controls
If the access level of a method in a class library has changed, recompile any assemblies that reference that library.
If a field in a class library has been removed, recompile any assemblies that reference that library.
If a member in a class library has been removed, recompile any assemblies that reference that library.
If you are attempting to access members on a late-bound object variable, make sure it is declared Public.
If a method in a class library has been removed, recompile any assemblies that reference that library.
Check to determine if there is a class that supports this functionality.
Use the "new" keyword to create an object instance.
Check to determine if the object is null before calling the method.
Make sure you have not released a resource before attempting to use it.
If you are creating an array, make sure the size is correct.
Be sure you have enough memory to allocate for internal purposes and new managed objects.
Make sure you are not dividing by zero.
Make sure your array has the required number of dimensions.
Make sure you do not have an infinite loop or infinite recursion.
Make sure you have sufficient privileges to access this resource.
If you are attempting to access a file, make sure it is not ReadOnly.
Relax or turn off constraints in your DataSet.
Be sure you are not trying to assign a value to a primary key field whose primary key already exists.
Clear datasets before loading them from view state.
Include logic in your application to handle concurrency violations.
Check the syntax of your expression.
Check if the value is DBNull before adding it to the column.
Set AllowDBNull to True.
Change the column to read/write.

Make sure the manifests for this application are valid.
Make sure that the printer exists.
Verify that the directory exists in the specified location.
When using relative paths, make sure the current directory is correct.
Check whether the end of the file has been reached before reading.
Make sure that the file is a valid .NET Framework assembly.

Make sure the path is not longer than the system-defined maximum.
Check the MessageQueueErrorCode property of the exception to determine why the Message Queue operation failed.
Make sure the cookie size does not exceed the maximum allowed by the cookie container.
Check the Response property of the exception to determine why the request failed.
Check the Status property of the exception to determine why the request failed.
Check the ErrorCode property to determine why the socket error occurred.
Check the ErrorCode property of the exception to determine the HRESULT returned by the COM object.
Disable the hosting process.
Make sure your array has the required number of dimensions.
Use a certificate to obtain the required permission(s).
When deploying an Office solution, check to make sure you have fulfilled all necessary security requirements.
If an assembly implementing the custom security object references other assemblies, add the referenced assemblies to the full trust assembly list.
Store application data in isolated storage.
Use the OpenFile method to open or save a file.
Adjust the permission level of the assembly via the property page.
Make sure the application is reading and writing to existing event logs on the local computer.
Use equivalent managed libraries.
Use safe windows.
